package.description:
rosdep attempts to help you manage the external dependencies of ROS. Because the ROS codebase is so wide-ranging, these dependencies can be hard to map onto your system. For example, what packages do you need in order to get the OpenGL headers on Ubuntu? (answer: libgl1-mesa-dev and libglu1-mesa-dev). These package names can sometimes be unfriendly, and, much more seriously, they usually vary slightly from one operating system or Linux distribution to another (e.g., Debian/Ubuntu versus Fedora), and can even vary between different versions of the same distribution. Enter rosdep.
The commandline API has been reviewed and will remain stable. The internal code API is subject to change in future releases.
The yaml format is stable. There may be a few extensions to the syntax, but all changes will keep backwards compatability.
